summary: This website has put together an AMAZING list of free online resources for the family.
This website offers help related to healthy food choices.
Get access to grade-specific lessons and activities using their “basic” package.
Find activities to do with your family throughout the day no matter what you’re doing.
The Free Reading Program offers reading activities and lessons for grades K-6.
ReadWorks.org allows caregivers to create an online reading classroom using free, leveled texts to give K-12 students reading practice.
Scholastic provides resources for families.
Find free online activities for children ages Kinder - 3rd grade.
TED provides videos on many different topics by experts and professionals around the world.
This Reading Mama provides many helpful posts and activities on all things reading.
A free digital library for children reading materials.
Read about a new topic every day of the week with your child by visiting Wonderopolis.
Electronic resources provided by the Riverside Country Library System
Audiobooks provided by the Riverside Country Library System
List of online services provided by the state of California
Find a mentor to help you apply to college and succeed once you’re there
Visit The Palm Springs Art Museum right from home and check out their At Home Art Activities
List of resources for high school seniors and college students impacted by COVID-19
Learn how to make a face mask with a paper towel

organization: Sesame Street: Monster Meditations with Headspace
summary: Cookie Monster can't wait for his cookies to be done baking! His friend Mr. Andy from Headspace is here to help with a Monster Meditation. Join Cookie Monster and Mr. Andy in a game of I-Sense, and discover how you can make waiting more fun!

organization: Readiness and Emergency Management for Schools
summary: Find guidance, resources, training, and tools in one centralized location on COVID-19 and infectious disease planning activities. This page is updated on a regular basis in order to provide you with the most up-to-date information. We encourage you to bookmark this page and check in daily.
